basic.floral_language:
Prunus armeniaca
Floriography: shy, pure, noble
Prunus armeniaca is a pretty tree with broad ovate leaves. Flower in clusters blossom before leaf growth. Flowers are single-layer or multi-layer petals with fresh and elegant colors, turning to pure white during the flowering period. Commonly used in yard landscaping, also making bonsai.
Prunus armeniaca likes adequate sunlight. Flowering from March to April for 1-2 weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period March-April, viewing period 1-2 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce water in summer to avoid root rots
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly in spring
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely
